00000000 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000047 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000094 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00000140 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000187 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

been feeling like that I should have laughed at him;

The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000234 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00000280 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000327 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

been feeling like that I should have laughed at him;

The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000374 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00000420 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000467 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

been feeling like that I should have laughed at him;

The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000514 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00000560 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000607 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000654 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life.

have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000700 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000747 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact.

00000793 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000840 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00000886 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00000933 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00000979 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00001026 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00001072 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00001119 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact.

you had better climb out.

'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00001165 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00001211 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00001258 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

you had better climb out.
00001304 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00001351 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life.

the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00001397 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00001443 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00001490 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact.

you had better climb out.

has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
00001536 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.

00001582 I returned from the City about three o'clock on that 
May afternoon pretty well disgusted with life. 
I had been three months in the Old Country, and was 
fed up with it. 
If anyone had told me a year ago that I would have 
been feeling like that I should have laughed at him; 
but there was the fact. 
The weather made me liverish, 
the talk of the ordinary Englishman made me sick, 
I couldn't get enough exercise, and the amusements 
of London seemed as flat as soda-water that 
has been standing in the sun. 
'Richard Hannay,' I kept telling myself, 'you 
have got into the wrong ditch, my friend, and 
you had better climb out.
